question.questionText: Ted poured the same amount of water into 2 small containers, X and Y. He placed them together where they would not be disturbed. After several days, all of the water had evaporated from one of the containers. The other container still had some water. Which container, X or Y, was empty? Explain why the water in that container evaporated more quickly than the water in the other container.

referenceAnswers.referenceAnswer: Container X has more surface area or more water exposed to the air so the water evaporated faster.

studentAnswers.studentAnswer: Because X had more room to evaporate and Y did not.
The water in container X had a more open space to evaporate, so it evaporated. The water in container Y could not evaporate because it did not have an open space to evaporate.
X evaporated more than Y because container X has more surface area than container Y so it evaporated faster.
There is more surface area on container X so more water could evaporate at one time.
The water in X evaporated because the more surface area the more air can get to it to make it evaporate faster.
X evaporated faster because it has more space to evaporate quicker.
